TopicTitle: You received a gift from someone

Articles.Content: And inside that gift is a functioning shoebox sized fusion reactor. What do you want to use it for?

A patent.

10chars
world domination
Power the flux capacitor in my Delorean
Hook it up to a carbon nanotube wire and force as much current as I can through it, hopefully finding that the tube still has no resistance to electricity.

What kind of power does it produce? Thermal? Electric? and how much? That's quite important

If it's about a MW I'd get a fancy electric car with a socket for it and drive that around forever, when at home i'd plug it into my house and refit all my appliance to be always on. Perpetually steaming jacuzzi, no more oven preheating, that kind of stuff. Oh and I'd have a tesla coil on the roof for lightning. One on my car as well come to think of it

I would borrow it to everyone and anyone that can learn from it, as fusion (and especially personal fusion) is something the world really could use. Not only would it probably mean (relatively) cheap power, but also that we have an excellent start when it comes to travelling interstellar distances. No need for a sun anymore, we will just pack our own.

Maybe some care would have to be taken to prevent political trouble, as powers will dramatically shift and interests will be completely different.
keep it hidden from the government and the environmentalists who'd ban me from using it because they don't want people to be energy independent.
Reverse engineer it, and provide humanity with neverending source of cheap, clean energy. Then wait for multiple Nobel Awards coming my way

Run.

Run and never look back. Kidnap a few physicists and get it reverse-engineered.
Hide it from the government who will probably want to slap you with a tax for using it
I bring about a post-scarcity economy.
I would ask NASA, ESA or Elon Musk if they want to use it to power a manned mission to Mars. In Exchange i want to fly with them an be the first human on Mars
Get it reverse engineered so humanity has unlimited cheap energy for the rest of eternity!
I'd put it in a box and mail it to some random person.

I would do the following, in chornological order.

1. Take out a $300,000 loan.

2. Reverse engineer the reactor myself and painstakingly build an exact working replica with the money I borrowed.

3. Call some physicists, and ask them to come to my home since I've built what appears to be an fusion reactor. Offer to pay their travel costs and everything.

4. Amaze the physicists, then explain how the reactor works

.

5. Get a patent.

6. Start an company.

7. Mass-manufacture the reactors, so in a couple years, every electrical powered vehicle now has an fusion reactor inside it, allowing for unpredecented range. Proceed to inform everyone that we nolonger need a dam on every river and an windmill on every hill.

8. Bribe Congress to put the oil colomogerates out of busniess.

9. Buy out my suppliers and competitors.

10. Move to Europa.

All that good and decent stuff...

After I've irradiated that neighbour that for months now have been trying to learn to play the guitar, sometimes for hours on end, and haven't.
Wow! A shoebox! Just the thing I needed to store these model rocket engines in (once I pull out all these wires and other doodads that are inside here).

A patent.
